Key Match Events: Phil Salt reaches fifty off 38 balls
Moeen Ali c Charles b Russell 13
Andre Russell c Salt b Rashid 1
Sherfane Rutherford c Buttler b Archer 28
Rovman Powell c Brook b Moeen 36
Mark Wood c Wood b Livingstone 36
Johnson Charles c Brook b Moeen 38
Pre-Game Insights: England win the toss and will bowl!
West Indies revert to their strongest side from the first round

Rovman Powell: 'I think we left 15-20 runs out there as a batting group but we could give a better display as a bowling group too. Yea we're normally very good in the last final overs but credit to the England team, it is just for us to revealuate.'

Jos Buttler: 'I thought it was a really good performance from us, we executed really well with the bat and ball. I thought we bowled really well to restrict such a powerful batting line up, and I thought we were very smart with the bat, Jonny came in with great intent and Salt tucked in behind him for a bit and then … went big. [Something positive I didn’t catch about Archer]…Adil Rashid, we keep saying he’s our most important players, so much variation in taking wickets and restricting runs. I thought today was a really mature senior player innings by Bairstow.'
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Salt: 'Not looking too far ahead at the minute,' says Salt, 'just looking at a good team win. it was a bit tougher in the middle against the spin. I've got to back myself to cash in agains the seamers.'

Rovman Powell: 'I think we left 15-20 runs out there as a batting group but we could give a better display as a bowling group too. Yea we're normally very good in the last final overs but credit to the England team, it is just for us to revealuate.'

Jos Buttler: 'I thought it was a really good performance from us, we executed really well with the bat and ball. I thought we bowled really well to restrict such a powerful batting line up, and I thought we were very smart with the bat, Jonny came in with great intent and Salt tucked in behind him for a bit and then … went big. [Something positive I didn’t catch about Archer]…Adil Rashid, we keep saying he’s our most important players, so much variation in taking wickets and restricting runs. I thought today was a really mature senior player innings by Bairstow.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies get a bloody nose and will need wins to go through – with USA and South Africa awaiting both teams.
England's Phil Salt hits a six during the T20 World Cup Super Eight match against the West Indies in Saint Lucia.
